Virat Kohli involved in heated argument with Australian TV journalist: 'I need privacy with my kids. You just can't...' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Virat Kohli Involves in Tense Exchange with Australian Journalist Over Children’s Privacy

Date: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: Hindustan Times

Virat Kohli had a heated argument with an Australian TV journalist at Melbourne airport as he felt his children were being filmed without consent. The former captain is known for being protective of his family.

  • Kohli became upset upon realizing video cameras pointed at his children.
  • He confronted the journalist, stating, "With my kids I need some privacy, you just can't film without asking me."
  • The situation was later clarified, and Kohli shook hands with the involved cameraperson.
  • His performance has been a concern in the ongoing Border-Gavaskar Trophy, where he's struggled apart from a century.
“It was upon seeing the waiting cameras that Kohli became a little heated...” – Theo Doropoulos, Channel 7 Reporter

The Border-Gavaskar Trophy series is currently tied 1-1, with the next match scheduled for December 26.
newTitle: Virat Kohli Involves in Tense Exchange with Australian Journalist Over Children’s Privacy

title: Who is Pratap Sarangi, BJP MP in ICU after scuffle at Parliament today? - Hindustan Times
summary:
Who is Pratap Sarangi, BJP MP in ICU after scuffle at Parliament today?

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: Hindustan Times

Protests erupted in Parliament following remarks by Home Minister Amit Shah, leading to injuries of two BJP MPs, including Pratap Sarangi.

  • Violent protests occurred due to Amit Shah's comments on Ambedkar.
  • MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput were hospitalized in ICU with severe injuries.
  • Opposition MPs staged protests demanding an apology from Amit Shah.
“Two MPs Pratap Sarangi and Mukesh Rajput are hospitalised at RML. The two are currently in ICU at the hospital.” - RML spokesperson Ajay Shukla

The incident highlights ongoing tensions in Indian politics, particularly regarding the opposition's reactions to government statements.
newTitle: Who is Pratap Sarangi, BJP MP in ICU after scuffle at Parliament today?

title: Ambedkar row: Parliament in chaos as Rahul's alleged push sends BJP MPs to ICU; Kharge says I was pushed too - Hindustan Times
summary:
Parliament Erupts in Chaos Over Rahul Gandhi's Alleged Push, BJP MPs Injured

Published on: No date provided Source: Hindustan Times

The ongoing political crisis in Indian Parliament escalated dramatically as Congress MP Rahul Gandhi allegedly pushed BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi, resulting in significant injuries and drawing widespread media attention.

  • Rahul Gandhi and other opposition MPs protested on the Makar Dwar, demanding an apology from Home Minister Amit Shah for controversial remarks about BR Ambedkar.
  • Two BJP MPs were hospitalized in ICU following the alleged incident, raising questions about parliamentary decorum.
  • Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge claimed he was also pushed during the melee.
  • Amit Shah's comments on BR Ambedkar have sparked outrage, leading to intensified protests from the opposition.
“Rahul Gandhi pushed an MP who fell on me after which I fell down...” - BJP MP Pratap Chandra Sarangi

The incident has opened a broader debate about the safety and decorum within the parliament, and further escalated tensions between ruling and opposition parties.
newTitle: Parliament Erupts in Chaos Over Rahul Gandhi's Alleged Push, BJP MPs Injured

Supreme Court Stays Kerala HC's Directions On Use Of Elephants For Temple Festivals Which Are Contrary To ... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
summary:
Supreme Court Stays Kerala HC's Directions On Use Of Elephants For Temple Festivals

Publication Date: December 19, 2024

Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court has effectively stayed the restrictions imposed by the Kerala High Court regarding the use of elephants in temple festivals, deeming the High Court's directions as impractical.

  • The Supreme Court ordered that any directions contrary to the Kerala Captive Elephants (Management and Maintenance) Rules, 2012, would remain stayed.
  • The ruling was made in an appeal from the Thiruvambady and Paramekkavu devaswoms.
  • The High Court's directions included specific distances elephants must maintain from the public and each other during festivals.
  • The Supreme Court criticized the High Court for overstepping its authority in regulating temple festivals.
Justice BV Nagarathna remarked that the High Court's directions were 'impractical'.

This decision allows for the continuation of traditional temple festivals in Kerala without the constraints imposed by the High Court.
newTitle: Supreme Court Stays Kerala HC's Directions On Use Of Elephants For Temple Festivals

title: After getting out of jail at Gabba, will Indian batters feel at 'home' in Melbourne? - The Times of India
summary:
After getting out of jail at Gabba, will Indian batters feel at 'home' in Melbourne?

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Times of India

India managed to draw the third Test against Australia at Gabba, ensuring the five-Test series remains tied at 1-1. The Indian team hopes to leverage their confidence in the upcoming matches in Melbourne and Sydney.

  • India was in a tough position at 74 for 5 chasing Australia's 445.
  • Key contributions came from KL Rahul (85) and Ravindra Jadeja (77).
  • After a rain-affected day, India avoided defeat thanks to tailenders who put up a fight.
  • Captain Rohit Sharma emphasizes the need to start fresh in Melbourne.
  • India must win both remaining matches to secure their place in the World Test Championship final.
  • Current performance of top Indian batters raises concerns, particularly Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli.
“Whatever happened today (last day of Brisbane Test), it gave us confidence ahead of Melbourne.” - Rohit Sharma

In conclusion, the Indian team is looking to build on their draw at Gabba while facing challenges in upcoming matches, aiming for victory to ensure their position in crucial tournament standings.
newTitle: After getting out of jail at Gabba, will Indian batters feel at 'home' in Melbourne?

title: Pushpa 2 box office collection day 14 [updated live]: Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna’s collects 975 cr - TOI Etimes
summary:
Pushpa 2 box office collection day 14 [updated live]: Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna’s collects 975 cr by 2nd Thursday morning; to join elusive 1000 crore club soon

Publication Date: December 14, 2023 | Source: Times of India

On the 14th day since its release, Pushpa 2 is nearing the monumental 1000 crore milestone at the box office, with current collections reported at 975 crores.

  • Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna star in the movie.
  • The film continues to perform remarkably well in theaters across India.
  • Industry experts predict that it will join the 1000 crore club soon.
“Pushpa 2's box office success marks a significant achievement for Indian cinema,” said a film industry analyst.

The successful performance of Pushpa 2 not only highlights its popularity among audiences but also sets a new benchmark for future Indian films.
newTitle: Pushpa 2 Achieves 975 Crore Box Office Milestone

title: Keshav Maharaj ruled out of last two Pakistan ODIs - Cricbuzz
summary:
Keshav Maharaj Ruled Out of Last Two Pakistan ODIs

Published on: Thu, Dec 19, 2024, 07:05 AM Source: Cricbuzz

South Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj is out of the remainder of the ongoing ODI series against Pakistan at home due to a left abductor strain, which he sustained while warming up for the series opener.

  • Maharaj was named in the starting lineup but did not play due to his injury.
  • He will miss the 2nd and 3rd ODIs on December 19 and 22.
  • Bjorn Fortuin has been named as his replacement for the fixtures.
  • He is also included in the Test squad despite his injury.
  • South Africa leads the World Test Championship table with a PCT of 63.330.
  • Maharaj will return home for rehabilitation ahead of an important Test match starting on December 26.
“Keshav will return home to Durban for rehabilitation and will be assessed ahead of the first Test.”

The absence of Keshav Maharaj in the ODI series is a significant blow for the South African team, but he remains integral to their Test squad aspirations.
newTitle: Keshav Maharaj Ruled Out of Last Two Pakistan ODIs

Vijay Mallya claims has paid double his debt, now ‘entitled to relief’ - Hindustan Times
summary:
Vijay Mallya Claims to Have Paid Double His Debt, Now Seeks Relief

Date: Dec 19, 2024
Source: HT News Desk

Vijay Mallya, a fugitive businessman, claims that he has paid off more than double the amount owed on his Kingfisher Airlines debt. He asserts that banks have recovered over ₹14,131 crore from him, while the Debt Recovery Tribunal stated the debt was ₹6,203 crore.

  • Mallya claims bank recoveries exceed twice the debt he was adjudged to owe.
  • He argues that he is entitled to relief unless excess recovery is legally justified.
  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman confirmed the recovery of properties worth ₹14,131 crore belonging to Mallya.
  • Mallya asserts his innocence, claiming he neither borrowed unlawfully nor stole funds.
  • He has been seeking extradition to India but faces ongoing resistance.
"Unless the ED and Banks can legally justify how they have taken more than two times the debt, I am entitled to relief which I will pursue," Mallya stated.

This controversy highlights ongoing disputes about Mallya's financial dealings and the broader implications for financial accountability in India.
newTitle: Vijay Mallya Claims to Have Paid Double His Debt, Now Seeks Relief

title: 9 Indian veggies and how much magnesium they contain - The Times of India
"By Letting R Ashwin Retire...": Harsha Bhogle's Blunt Message For Veterans Kohli, Rohit - NDTV Sports
summary:
By Letting R Ashwin Retire...: Harsha Bhogle's Blunt Message For Veterans Kohli, Rohit

Publication Date: December 18, 2024
Source: NDTV Sports

Ravichandran Ashwin's recent retirement from international cricket has sent shockwaves through the cricketing community, prompting reflections on the future of other veterans on the team.

  • Ashwin's retirement was unexpected, occurring during the Brisbane Test against Australia.
  • Harsha Bhogle commented that this event sets a precedent for other aging players such as Kohli and Rohit.
  • The selection of Washington Sundar over Ashwin further highlights shifting dynamics within the team.
  • There are concerns that the upcoming season may witness further retirements among veteran players.
"By letting Ashwin retire, and he would be playing if he was picked, the selectors have set the bar for everyone else. Interesting times ahead," - Harsha Bhogle.

Ashwin has expressed a desire to focus on club cricket moving forward, indicating a significant shift in his cricketing career.
newTitle: Harsha Bhogle's Message for Veterans After R Ashwin's Retirement

title: Kia Syros Breaks Cover, Launch Expected In January 2025 - CarDekho
summary:
Kia Syros Breaks Cover, Launch Expected In January 2025

Date: October 2023 | Source: CarDekho.com

The Kia Syros has been unveiled in India with a launch expected in January 2025. It is designed to fit between the Kia Sonet and Seltos, bringing additional features and a modern design.

  • Available in six broad variants: HTK, HTK (O), HTK Plus, HTX, HTX Plus, and HTX Plus (O).
  • Boxy SUV design inspired by Kia EV9 with 3-pod LED headlights and flush-type door handles.
  • Interior features dual-tone black and grey cabin with a 2-spoke steering wheel.
  • Equipped with dual 12.3-inch screens, panoramic sunroof, and ventilated seats.
  • Safety features include 6 airbags and a 360-degree camera.
  • Powered by a 1-litre turbo-petrol or a 1.5-litre diesel engine.
  • Expected pricing starts at Rs 9 lakh (ex-showroom).
"The Kia Syros features a lineup of premium specifications not previously offered in the existing models."

The Kia Syros is set to enhance Kia's SUV portfolio in India with its anticipated unique features and design.
newTitle: Kia Syros Unveiled with Launch Planned for January 2025

title: ChatGPT comes to WhatsApp: How to use OpenAI chatbot on phone, tablet, or PC - The Financial Express
summary:
ChatGPT Now Available on WhatsApp: How to Start Using It

Publication Date: December 18, 2024 | Source: Financial Express

OpenAI has announced that ChatGPT can now be accessed via WhatsApp, allowing users to interact with the AI chatbot without needing the app or sign-in.

  • ChatGPT is accessible through WhatsApp and phone calls, expanding accessibility.
  • Users can call ChatGPT toll-free at 1-800-CHAT-GPT.
  • Global users can add ChatGPT on WhatsApp by scanning a QR code shared during a demo.
  • This launch is part of OpenAI's initiative to reduce barriers to AI access.
“We care about reducing barriers for more people to try AI and see what it can do,” said Antonia W, product manager at OpenAI.

This new development marks a significant step towards making advanced AI technology widely accessible to users worldwide.
newTitle: ChatGPT Now Available on WhatsApp: How to Start Using It

title: Laapataa Ladies' Oscars drama explained: How India selects 'official' entry, what is Film Federation of India's role - Hindustan Times
summary:
Laapataa Ladies' Oscars Drama Explained: How India Selects Official Entry

Date: Dec 19, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

As Laapataa Ladies crashes out of the Oscars race, this article explores the selection process for India's 'official' entry to the Academy Awards, shedding light on the role of the Film Federation of India.

  • This year marks the 23rd consecutive year that India will not have a film in the Oscars' Best International Feature Film category.
  • The Film Federation of India (FFI) is responsible for selecting India's official entry for the Oscars.
  • Laapataa Ladies was chosen from nearly 30 contenders, including notable films like Animal and All We Imagine as Light.
  • Only one film can be submitted as an 'official' entry, but filmmakers can still submit titles independently for other categories.
  • Historically, three Indian films have been nominated for the Oscars: Mother India, Salaam Bombay, and Lagaan.
“It has never been without drama.”

The ongoing struggles in selecting a film for international representation highlight the challenges faced by Indian cinema on the global stage.
newTitle: Laapataa Ladies' Oscars Drama Explained: India's Official Selection Process

title: Rahul Gandhi Says "Way Blocked" After BJP MP Injured In Parliament Showdown - NDTV
summary:
BJP Blames Rahul Gandhi for Violence in Parliament Amid Protests

Date: December 19, 2024 Source: NDTV

Protests erupted in Parliament following a controversial remark by Home Minister Amit Shah, with accusations of violence exchanged between BJP and Congress MPs.

Key Points:

  • Two BJP MPs were reported injured during the altercation, which BJP attributes to Rahul Gandhi's actions.
  • Congress claims BJP MPs caused the confrontation by blocking Gandhi from entering Parliament.
  • The incident has led to legal action threats from the BJP against Rahul Gandhi.
  • Amit Shah's remarks regarding Dr. Ambedkar sparked significant backlash, prompting protests.
“Parliament is not a wrestling arena,” said Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju, criticizing Gandhi's behavior.

This incident highlights the escalating tensions between the ruling party and the opposition amid ongoing debates over controversial remarks.
newTitle: BJP Blames Rahul Gandhi for Violence in Parliament Amid Protests

title: SpiceJet resolves $16-million dispute with aircraft lessor Genesis; shares jump nearly 9% - Upstox
summary:
SpiceJet Settles $16 Million Dispute with Genesis, Shares Surge Nearly 9%

Date: Recently Source: Bombay Stock Exchange

SpiceJet shares saw an increase of nearly 9% following the airline's announcement of a settlement with Genesis, resolving a $16 million dispute.

  • The airline will pay $6 million in cash and issue $4 million in equity.
  • The dispute resolution includes the withdrawal of all ongoing litigations.
  • Chairman Ajay Singh emphasized the settlement's importance for financial stability.
  • Previously, SpiceJet settled disputes with multiple lessors.
  • SpiceJet aims to operate 35 aircraft by March 2025, expanding to 100 by FY27.
“This agreement... will significantly reduce our financial liabilities and further strengthen our balance sheet.” - Ajay Singh

This settlement marks a significant step in SpiceJet's ongoing efforts to stabilize its financial situation and improve operations.
newTitle: SpiceJet Settles $16 Million Dispute with Genesis, Shares Surge Nearly 9%

title: "Entitled To Relief": Vijay Mallya On Banks Recovering Rs 14,131 Crore Assets - NDTV
summary:
Vijay Mallya Claims Banks Have Recovered ₹14,131 Crore, Seeks Legal Relief

Publication Date: July 26, 2024

Source: NDTV

Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya stated that banks have recovered ₹14,131.60 crore from him against a judgement debt of ₹6,203 crore, arguing he is entitled to relief unless banks can justify this recovery amount.

  • Mallya claims banks exceeded the debt recovery limit set by the Debt Recovery Tribunal.
  • Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman reported a total recovery of ₹22,280 crore from various economic offenders.
  • In Mallya's specific case, ₹14,131.6 crores of his assets have been restored to public sector banks.
  • Other economic offenders like Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi are also mentioned with significant amounts recovered.

“The Debt Recovery Tribunal adjudged the KFA debt at ₹6,203 crores including ₹1,200 crores of interest.” — Vijay Mallya

The government is actively pursuing individuals involved in economic offences, with assurances to restore funds to banks.
newTitle: Vijay Mallya Claims Banks Have Recovered ₹14,131 Crore, Seeks Legal Relief

title: Virat Kohli Involved In Heated Exchange With Australian TV Journalist For Privacy Breach In Melbourne: Report - Times Now
summary:
Virat Kohli Involved In Heated Exchange With Australian TV Journalist For Privacy Breach In Melbourne: Report

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: The West Australian

Virat Kohli reportedly engaged in a heated altercation with an Australian TV journalist in Melbourne before the Boxing Day Test. Kohli was apparently upset by cameras directed at his family, emphasizing his desire for privacy, especially concerning his children.

  • Kohli had a tense conversation with the journalist over privacy concerns.
  • He has explicitly instructed media not to photograph his children.
  • Kohli has struggled with his form in the Border-Gavaskar Trophy, impacting India's performance.
  • India needs to win upcoming matches to secure a place in the WTC final.
“Kohli has mandated the Indian media to keep the cameras off his kids.”

Though Kohli's recent performance has been lacking, his contribution is crucial for India's chances in the series. A strong performance could alter the trajectory of their World Test Championship hopes.

title: California Governor Declares State Of Emergency Due To Bird Flu - NDTV
summary:
California Governor Declares State of Emergency Due to Bird Flu

Publication Date: December 13, 2024 | Source: CBS News

California Governor Gavin Newsom has declared a state of emergency in response to an outbreak of Avian influenza A (H5N1), commonly known as bird flu, which has infected 34 people in the state.

  • The declaration follows the detection of the virus in dairy cattle in Southern California.
  • No person-to-person transmission of bird flu has been identified in California.
  • A large testing and monitoring system has been implemented across the state.
  • Nationwide, 61 human cases of H5N1 have been reported since April.
  • California has distributed protective gear to dairy farms for enhanced safety.
No person-to-person transmission of bird flu has been identified in California. Most individuals infected in the state were exposed to infected cows.

The declaration underscores the urgency of enhancing monitoring and response measures to mitigate the spread of the virus amidst rising cases.
newTitle: California Governor Declares State of Emergency Due to Bird Flu

title: BJP Accuses Rahul Gandhi Of Pushing Its MP In Parliament Complex Chaos, Considers Police Complaint - News18
Japan's ispace to land spacecraft on Moon's Sea of Cold, take a long lunar route - India Today
summary:
Japan's ispace to land spacecraft on Moon's Sea of Cold, take a long lunar route

Published On: Dec 19, 2024 | Source: India Today

Ispace, a Tokyo-based lunar exploration company, has announced its second lunar mission targeting a soft landing on the Moon's Sea of Cold.

  • The six-day launch window opens in mid-January 2025.
  • The mission will deploy a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket.
  • The lunar lander will take several months to reach the Moon using a low-energy trajectory.
  • Mission 2 aims to execute a lunar flyby and soft landing, utilizing backup sites for mission flexibility.
“Mission 2 represents our continued commitment to the lunar economy,” said Takeshi Hakamada, Founder & CEO of ispace.

This mission underlines the synergy between private space companies and international agencies, enhancing the development of a robust lunar economy.
newTitle: Japan's ispace to land spacecraft on Moon's Sea of Cold, take a long lunar route

title: 6 things to do while walking to improve heart health - The Times of India
summary:
6 Things to Do While Walking to Improve Heart Health

Publication Date: October 2023
Source: Times of India

Walking is one of the simplest and most effective ways to keep our heart in good shape. Adding a few extra activities into your walking routine can bring big rewards for heart health. Here are 6 things you can do while walking to boost your heart health.

  • Walk with purpose: Increase the pace to improve blood circulation and strengthen the heart muscle.
  • Add intervals: Alternate between brisk and slower walking to challenge your cardiovascular system.
  • Use your arms: Swinging arms or holding light weights can enhance aerobic activity and calorie burn.
  • Incorporate breathing exercises: Deep breathing while walking can lower stress levels and improve oxygen saturation.
  • Take nature walks: Walking in green spaces reduces stress hormones and promotes better heart health.
  • Track your steps: Aim for 7,000–10,000 steps daily to reduce the risk of heart disease.
"Every small effort counts toward a healthier heart."

Walking is great for heart health, and these activities can enhance your routine. Start today by making small changes that can lead to big benefits.
newTitle: 6 Things to Do While Walking to Improve Heart Health

title: NASA Warns Of Two Massive Asteroids Set For Close Encounter With Earth On THIS Date, Check Time, Speed And Dis - Times Now
summary:
NASA Warns Of Two Massive Asteroids Set For Close Encounter With Earth

Date: December 21, 2024 | Source: Times Now

NASA is keeping a close watch on two house-sized asteroids, 2024 XQ4 and 2024 XN15, which will make their closest approaches to Earth on December 21, 2024. NASA confirms that they pose no threat to our planet.

  • Asteroid 2024 XQ4 has a diameter of 50 feet and will pass within 1,060,000 kilometers of Earth at 47,634 km/h at 3:03 PM IST.
  • Asteroid 2024 XN15 is approximately 60 feet in diameter, passing at a distance of 3,780,000 kilometers at 35,051 km/h, closest at 2:38 PM IST.
  • Both asteroids do not classify as Potentially Hazardous Objects according to NASA's criteria.
  • NASA utilizes a network of telescopes for tracking Near-Earth Objects to assess their trajectories and risks.
“Neither of these asteroids classifies as a Potentially Hazardous Object (PHO).”

This monitoring highlights the effectiveness of NASA's tracking systems, ensuring public safety while observing celestial phenomena.
newTitle: NASA Warns Of Two Massive Asteroids Set For Close Encounter With Earth
